body:
My first idea when implementing was to make it works just like full_messages but with a hash instead of an array as a return by default, and with an array when passing full as true. When calling it without parameters, a hash is necessary to associate the error messages to each attribute, but with the attribute on the message, this isn't necessary, so an array is returned.

This way, we would have:

```ruby
errors.unique_messages
{ :name => "is invalid and can't be blank",  :email => "is invalid"}
errors.unique_messages[:name]
"is invalid and can't be blank"
errors.unique_messages(true)
[ "name is invalid and can't be blank",  "email is invalid"]
```

I think the same as to be poor. But i was just following the full_messages method. :bowtie:

That helper was just an example to explain what i mean. Was not to match exactly the implementation. Sorry if i didn't make it clear enough.

I will look into the another tips further. 

Finally, Thank you. I didn't know of the method to_sentence yet. =D
